instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A water damaged
threads.message: Hi , i have this motherboard there was corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C5008</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C5007</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C5002</CAPACITOR> i replaced them from a donor board and get 3.4v again , trouble is when i plug the power in i get no screen no chime but i get fan spin, it draws 0.4 amps for 20 sec then shuts off then starts backup and goes from 0.4 up to 0.7 then shuts off for good. the cpu gets warm . hope this discription is ok there was only a small amount of liquid  and didnt reach the smc from what i can see, please help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A water damaged
threads.message: I bet for corrosion between SMC balls; reball it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A water damaged
threads.message: Thanks for the reply , i have reballed the smc i didn't see any damage or corrosion but i now get 0.60 amps for 10 seconds and it powers off .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A water damaged
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Clean/remove J6100.
Try known good BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A water damaged
threads.message: thank you new bios fixed it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A water damaged
threads.message: I hope you have cleaned ME region...
